messageBody:
Here is an update of what I have found so far.

If I let Ant build my classpath at runtime to run my JUnit test I
get the following error listed below. The odd thing is that when JUnit
echos my classpath it list the junit.jar right there in the classpath
statement. Anyone have a clue of what is going on?

--- In junit@y..., bugfix4u@y... wrote:
> Yes JUnit is definetly in the classpath. Like I said I use the same
> <classpath refid="test.build.classpath"/> to compile all of my JUnit
> test with no problem. But when I use this line in the target that
runs
> my Junit classes It can not find it. The difference here being that
> the javac task def has no problem understanding <classpath
> refid="test.build.classpath"/> statement while the junit taskdef
seem
> to ignore it. I could redefine my classpath using the form that you
> used in your example, but that defeats the purpose of me predefining
> my test classpath so that I can using over an over again in
different
> targets.
